comments.body: @trondhindenes After a couple rounds of "WTH?!" with this on my Win10 box (it took 3 reboots to get to "false"- Chrome kept putting things in the PendingFileRenameOperations key), I'm thinking we might want an optional ref arg where we'll return a list of the reasons. I also have a couple more locations to look (win updates, CBS, etc), so with all those places, it'd probably be good to know why a reboot is pending.
Not sure, but might you also want to include `-LiteralPath`? Depends on if we accept paths with wildcards as type `path` (can't remember if we discussed either way)...

Good question, I refrained from making this modifications in other modules (where it should be -LiteralPath), but here it is uncertain. Since I am mostly interested in invalid paths (outside of the scope of wildcards) I don't mind changing it either way.

To be discussed.

I did some messing around, and I haven't been able to find a situation where `LiteralPath` makes any difference in combination with `IsValid` (there are some real-world file situations where it does, but only when testing for presence, not validity). Wildcard/glob values aren't accepted either way (eg `C:\foo\bar*`), so any arg that accepts a wildcard can't be marked as type `path` regardless...
